entry.name: MAV_CMD_PARAM_TRANSACTION
entry.description: Request to start or end a parameter transaction. Multiple kinds of transport layers can be used to exchange parameters in the transaction (param, param_ext and mavftp). The command response can either be a success/failure or an in progress in case the receiving side takes some time to apply the parameters.
entry.param: Action to be performed (start, commit, cancel, etc.)
Possible transport layers to set and get parameters via mavlink during a parameter transaction.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CAMERA_TRACK_OBJECT
entry.description: Start tracking an object by referencing it's ID

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CAMERA_TRACKING_ADJUSTMENT
entry.description: Provides fine adjustments to a tracking window position in the video feed. The position adjustments are sent as relative step changes from the current tracking point.
entry.param: Horizontal adjustment in steps relative to the current position. Negative values shift the target left; positive values shift it right.
Vertical adjustment in steps relative to the current position. Negative values shift the target upward; positive values shift it downward.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_CONTROL_TAKEOVER
entry.description: Commands to take over control from the safety driver. This command cannot give control to safety driver.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_ENGINE_LEG_TRIM
entry.description: Set engine leg trim position. Can execute trim for individual legs or all legs at once.
entry.param: Executes engine leg trimming for all selected engines(0: Down, 1:up)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ENGINE_STATE
entry.description: Commands the desired state for vehicle engines.
entry.param: Commanded engine state for the selected engines.

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_TRACKER
entry.description: Tracker #1.

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_TRACKER2
entry.description: Tracker #2.

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_TRACKER3
entry.description: Tracker #3.

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_TRACKER4
entry.description: Tracker #4.

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_TRACKER5
entry.description: Tracker #5.

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_TRACKER6
entry.description: Tracker #6.

enum.name: CURRENT_CONTROL_ENTITY
enum.description: List of the currently active control entity.

entry.name: CURRENT_CONTROL_ENTITY_NONE
entry.description: Setting if no entity has control ownership.

entry.name: CURRENT_CONTROL_ENTITY_OWNER
entry.description: Setting if the receiving GCS is the control entity.

entry.name: CURRENT_CONTROL_ENTITY_OTHER
entry.description: Setting if a GCS other than the receiving GCS is the control entity.

enum.name: CONTROL_TARGET_REQUEST
enum.description: Selection of control target for changing ownership.

entry.name: CONTROL_TARGET_ALL
entry.description: Request change control ownership of both flight control and payload control.

entry.name: CONTROL_TARGET_FLIGHT
entry.description: Request change control ownership of the flight control.

entry.name: CONTROL_TARGET_PAYLOAD
entry.description: Request change control ownership of the payload control.

enum.name: CONTROL_REQUEST_ERROR_CODE
enum.description: Error code for the control request response.

entry.name: CONTROL_REQUEST_PROCESSED
entry.description: Code indicating successful processing of the request.

entry.name: CONTROL_REQUEST_DENIED
entry.description: Error code indicating that the control request has been denied by the target system.

entry.name: CONTROL_REQUEST_HANDOFF_TIMEOUT
entry.description: Error Code indicating timeout on the handoff request.

entry.name: CONTROL_REQUEST_DENIED_CONCURRENT
entry.description: Error Code indicating another control request is in process.

entry.name: CONTROL_REQUEST_NO_CONTROL_AUTHORITY
entry.description: Error Code indicating no enough authority to take control ownership.

entry.name: CONTROL_REQUEST_NO_PRIORITY_AUTHORITY
entry.description: Error Code indicating no enough priority authority control ownership.

enum.name: HANDOFF_DECISION
enum.description: Decision of the GCS to a handoff request.

entry.name: HANDOFF_DECISION_ACCEPT
entry.description: Decision to accept the handoff and release control ownership.

entry.name: HANDOFF_DECISION_DENIED
entry.description: Decision to deny the handoff request and keep control ownership.

enum.name: PARAM_TRANSACTION_TRANSPORT
enum.description: Possible transport layers to set and get parameters via mavlink during a parameter transaction.

entry.name: PARAM_TRANSACTION_TRANSPORT_PARAM
entry.description: Transaction over param transport.

entry.name: PARAM_TRANSACTION_TRANSPORT_PARAM_EXT
entry.description: Transaction over param_ext transport.

entry.name: PARAM_TRANSACTION_ACTION_START
entry.description: Commit the current parameter transaction.

entry.name: PARAM_TRANSACTION_ACTION_COMMIT
entry.description: Commit the current parameter transaction.

entry.name: PARAM_TRANSACTION_ACTION_CANCEL
entry.description: Cancel the current parameter transaction.

enum.name: ENGINE_LEG_TRIM_STATE
enum.description: Defines the position status of a engine leg trim.

entry.name: ENGINE_LEG_TRIM_NONE
entry.description: ENGINE_LEF_TRIM_NONE indicates no engine leg trim system is present.

entry.name: ENGINE_LEG_TRIM_STOWED
entry.description: ENGINE_LEG_TRIM_STOWED means leg is lifted and the engine should not be started.

entry.name: ENGINE_LEG_TRIM_CRUISE
entry.description: ENGINE_LEG_TRIM_CRUISE defines the active operational position of the engine leg.

entry.name: ENGINE_LEG_TRIM_FAULT
entry.description: ENGINE_LEG_TRIM_FAULT indicates a faulty state in the engine leg trimming system.

enum.name: RUDDER_STATE
enum.description: Defines health state of a rudder.

entry.name: RUDDER_NONE
entry.description: RUDDER_NONE indicates no rudder system is present.

entry.name: RUDDER_OK
entry.description: RUDDER_OK indicates the rudder is operating correctly.

entry.name: RUDDER_FAULT
entry.description: RUDDER_FAULT indicates a fault in the rudder system.

enum.name: ENGINE_STATE
enum.description: Defines the operation state of an engine.

entry.name: ENGINE_NONE
entry.description: ENGINE_NONE indicates engine is not running and ignition is off.

entry.name: ENGINE_STOPPED
entry.description: ENGINE_STOPPED indicates the engine is not running, but ignition is on.

entry.name: ENGINE_STARTING
entry.description: ENGINE_STARTING indicates the engine is starting.

entry.name: ENGINE_RUNNING
entry.description: ENGINE_RUNNING indicates the engine is running.

entry.name: ENGINE_FAULT
entry.description: ENGINE_FAULT indicates a fault in the engine system.

enum.name: TRANSMISSION_STATE
enum.description: Defines the operation state of a transmission.

entry.name: TRANSMISSION_NONE
entry.description: TRANSMISSION_NONE indicates no transmission system is present.

entry.name: TRANSMISSION_NEUTRAL
entry.description: TRANSMISSION_NEUTRAL indicates the transmission is in neutral.

entry.name: TRANSMISSION_FORWARD
entry.description: TRANSMISSION_FORWARD indicates the transmission is in forward.

entry.name: TRANSMISSION_REVERSE
entry.description: TRANSMISSION_REVERSE indicates the transmission is in reverse.

entry.name: TRANSMISSION_FAULT
entry.description: TRANSMISSION_FAULT indicates a fault in the transmission system.

enum.name: FLUID_TANK_TYPE
enum.description: Defines the type of fluid contained in a tank.

entry.name: TANK_TYPE_FUEL
entry.description: TANK_TYPE_FUEL indicates the tank contains fuel.

entry.name: TANK_TYPE_WATER
entry.description: TANK_TYPE_WATER indicates the tank contains fresh water.

entry.name: TANK_TYPE_GRAY_WATER
entry.description: TANK_TYPE_GRAY_WATER indicates the tank contains gray water.

entry.name: TANK_TYPE_LIVE_WELL
entry.description: TANK_TYPE_LIVE_WELL indicates the tank is a live well.

entry.name: TANK_TYPE_OIL
entry.description: TANK_TYPE_OIL indicates the tank contains engine or hydraulic oil.

entry.name: TANK_TYPE_BLACK_WATER
entry.description: TANK_TYPE_BLACK_WATER indicates the tank contains black water.

enum.name: SPEED_WATER_REFERENCED_TYPE
enum.description: Defines the type of sensor used for measuring speed through water.

entry.name: REFERENCED_TYPE_PADDLE_WHEEL
entry.description: REFERENCED_TYPE_PADDLE_WHEEL indicates speed is measured using a paddle wheel sensor.

entry.name: REFERENCED_TYPE_PITOT_TUBE
entry.description: REFERENCED_TYPE_PITOT_TUBE indicates speed is measured using a pitot tube.

entry.name: REFERENCED_TYPE_DOPPLER
entry.description: REFERENCED_TYPE_DOPPLER indicates speed is measured using a Doppler-based sensor.

entry.name: REFERENCED_TYPE_CORRELATION
entry.description: REFERENCED_TYPE_CORRELATION indicates speed is measured using a correlation-based sensor.

entry.name: REFERENCED_TYPE_ELECTRO_MAGNETIC
entry.description: REFERENCED_TYPE_ELECTRO_MAGNETIC indicates speed is measured using an electromagnetic flow sensor.

enum.name: WIND_REFERENCE
enum.description: Specifies the frame of reference used for wind direction and speed measurements.

entry.name: REFERENCE_TRUE
entry.description: REFERENCE_TRUE Wind referenced to geographic (true) North.

entry.name: REFERENCE_MAGNETIC
entry.description: REFERENCE_MAGNETIC Wind referenced to magnetic North.

entry.name: REFERENCE_APPARENT
entry.description: REFERENCE_APPARENT Apparent wind relative to the vessel.

entry.name: REFERENCE_TRUE_BOAT_REFERENCED
entry.description: REFERENCE_TRUE_BOAT_REFERENCED True wind direction relative to the boat's heading, corrected for vessel movement but not Earth-referenced..

entry.name: REFERENCE_TRUE_WATER_REFERENCED
entry.description: REFERENCE_TRUE_WATER_REFERENCED True wind direction relative to the water surface.

message.name: PARAM_ACK_TRANSACTION
message.description: Response from a PARAM_SET message when it is used in a transaction.
message.field: Id of system that sent PARAM_SET message.
Id of system that sent PARAM_SET message.

Parameter id, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 16 human-readable chars and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 16 chars - applications have to provide 16+1 bytes storage if the ID is stored as string
Parameter value (new value if PARAM_ACCEPTED, current value otherwise)

message.name: BEACON_POSITION
message.description: Position of and distance to a Beacon.
message.field: Distance to the Beacon, in meters
Time between generating the value and request, in milliseconds
Status indicating the quality of the GPS Data. 0=invalid 1=lat long valid, alt invalid 2=valid
Value indicating the Signal to noise ratio (in units of dB)

message.name: RADIATION_DETECTOR_COUNTS
message.description: Radiation Detector counts/sec
message.field: Timestamp of measurement(UNIX Epoch time or time since detector boot)
Detector count in the current dt integration period.

message.name: RADIATION_DETECTOR_SPECTRUM
message.description: Radiation Detector Energy Spectrum
message.field: One segment of a spectrum PDU

message.name: RADIATION_DETECTOR_CPS
message.description: Radiation Detector counts/sec

message.name: TRACKER_STATUS
message.description: Current status of the tracker. This message should be broadcast a low regular rate e.g. 1 Hz.
message.field: The UID of the object currently being tracked.

message.name: TRACKER_DETECTION_2D
message.description: Contains information on an object detection in a video stream. Note that the video frame (image) ID must uniquely identify the same frame on all receiving devices.
message.field: Unique ID specifiying the video frame (image) in the message sender video stream.
Unique ID specifiying the class of the object.
Confidence score in the range of [0, 100] for the classifcation.
Relative image x coordinate (left to right axis) in the range of [0.00, 100.00] describing the top left corner of the bounding box .
Relative image y coordinate (top to bottom axis) in the range of [0.00, 100.00] describing the top left corner of the bounding box.
Relative image x coordinate (left to right axis) in the range of [0.00, 100.00] describing the bottom right corner of the bounding box.
Relative image y coordinate (top to bottom axis) in the range of [0.00, 100.00] describing the bottom left corner of the bounding box.
Latitude in WGS84 coordinate frame of the detected object. NAN if unknown.
Longitude in WGS84 coordinate frame of the detected object. NAN if unknown.
Altitude in EGM96 coordiante frame of the detected object. NAN if unknown.
North velocity of the object in global frame. NAN if unknown.
East velocity of the object in global frame. NAN if unknown.
Up velocity of the object in global frame. NAN if unknown.

message.name: JOYSTICK_STATE
message.description: State of all axes and buttons of a mavlink joystick
message.field: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.
Type of the MAV (quadrotor, helicopter, etc.), MAV_TYPE_JOYSTICK = 43

message.name: PIXEL_TO_LLA_REQUEST
message.description: Request the geographic coordinates (latitude, longitude, and altitude (MSL WGS84)) corresponding to a specific pixel location in an image frame.
message.field: Camera ID of the image source.
Unix time stamp of the image.
Relative image x coordinate (left to right axis) in the range of [0.0, 1.0].
Relative image y coordinate (top to bottom axis) in the range of [0.0, 1.0].

message.name: PIXEL_TO_LLA_ACK
message.description: ACK response for the REQUEST_PIXEL_TO_LLA message. Indicates whether the request was accepted or rejected.
message.field: 0 = Rejected, 1 = Accepted (with an optional error message).
Optional error message in case of rejection. Max length 100 characters.

message.name: PIXEL_TO_LLA_RESULT
message.description: Result of the pixel-to-LLA request. Includes the Unix timestamp, geographic coordinates (LLA), and the 3x3 matrix for the NED homography transform of the image, or an error status if the request failed.
message.field: 0 = Failure, 1 = Success. If failure, error_message will provide details.
Latitude of the requested pixel (degrees, WGS84).
Longitude of the requested pixel (degrees, WGS84).
Altitude of the requested pixel (meters, WGS84 ellipsoid).
3x3 matrix for NED (North-East-Down) homography transform of the image. Row-major order.
Optional error message in case of failure. Max length 100 characters.

message.name: BOAT_ACTUATOR_STATUS
message.description: Boat actuator status reports status and position of all boat control surfaces (currently rudders, engine leg trims).
message.field: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

message.name: BOAT_ENGINE_STATUS
message.description: Boat engine status reports status and position of all boat engines.
message.field: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

message.name: BOAT_BATTERY_STATUS
message.description: Boat battery status reports battery status as interpreted through NMEA2000.
message.field: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

message.name: BOAT_FLUID_LEVEL
message.description: Boat fluid level reports fluid levels as interpreted through NMEA2000.
message.field: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.
Fluid level in percentage of full tank.
Fluid capacity left in tank in liters.

message.name: BOAT_SPEED
message.description: Boat speed reports speeds as interpreted through NMEA2000.
message.field: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

message.name: BOAT_WATER_DEPTH
message.description: Boat water depth reports water depth as interpreted through NMEA2000.
message.field: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.
Distance between transducer and surface (positive) or keel (negative).

message.name: BOAT_WIND_DATA
message.description: Boat wind data reports wind data as interpreted through NMEA2000..
message.field: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

message.name: MOTOR_INFO
message.description: Contains information about a motor.
message.field: Motor index number starting with index 1. 0 if unknown.
The type of motor, TODO: define an enum
Temperature of motor. INT16_MAX if unknown.

message.name: CONTROL_STATUS_REPORT
message.description: Status message indicating the currently active flight control and payload control entity. This message should typically be send from the system at a low frequency as well as after a control ownership change to all connected GCS.

message.name: REQUEST_CONTROL
message.description: Request the flight control and/or the payload control of the target system by a GCS. The message can be used in a multi GCS environment. A GCS can request the control ownership of the target system.
message.field: Control target to change to own ownership.

Priority of the control request. If the priority is higher than the priority of the current control entity, control is given without handoff request. The priority request should be authenticated on the target system before granting this privilegs. Default value of 0.
Identification of the control entity requesting ownership.

message.name: REQUEST_CONTROL_ACK
message.description: Error code response of the target system to the control ownership request.

message.name: RELEASE_CONTROL
message.description: Release the previously aquired control. The message can be used in a multi GCS environment to release the control of the target system. This message is ignored when the GCS is not the current active control entity of the control target.
message.field: Control target to release own ownership.

message.name: REQUEST_HANDOFF
message.description: Request handoff of current control entity. This message is send from the system to the current active control entity to request the handoff of the control target to another GCS.
message.field: Control target to handoff control ownership.
Identification of the control entity requesting ownership.
Reason from the control entity requesting ownership.

message.name: HANDOFF_RESPOND
message.description: Handoff response to handoff request. This message is the response from the GCS in control to the handoff request.

message.name: UNIQUE_IDENTIFIER
message.description: Unique identifier message to uniquely identify different GCS and systems using an 256 bit uuid. The uuid can be randomly generated an stored for the relevant systems. Note: this message can be requested by sending the MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE with param1=13470.
